form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cruz introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To apply laws that restrict the political speech of American citizens to media corporations.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Free All Speech Act of 2014.

section.header: Application of laws that restrict the political speech of American citizens to media corporations

subsection.text: Any law that restricts the political speech of American citizens shall apply with equal force to media corporations, such as the New York Times, the American Broadcasting Company (ABC), the National Broadcasting Company (NBC), and the CBS Television Network.

subsection.header: No application to American citizens if application to media corporations found unconstitutional
subsection.text: To the extent that the application of a law to a media corporation under subsection (a) is found unconstitutional, such law shall have no force or effect with respect to American citizens.
